author: popinfresh

comments.content:
I guess it’s an amateur free font, cause it’s so horrible.  
Just look at the counter of the ‘O’!  
If this is a Futura at all it’s the worst cut of it I’ve ever seen.
It's the bad old Adobe version, from the first batch of Type 1 fonts they released back in the Eighties. It was fixed years ago, but a lot of people never upgraded.

Yecch. I was thinking it could be a badly traced logo...

- Lex
Was the data at that time Adobe's? Or were they importing someone else's data to create the font?

That's a good question. I don't know the answer. I just remember that the early Adobe fonts were a little uneven. I still have the floppy disks. I got my "Futura 2" disk from Linotype through a service bureau. The Linotype and Adobe font data was identical, as I recall. I'm sure the tools they used to make those early fonts was nothing like what we have now. They probably had to work out the outlines on graph paper, type raw PostScript code into a terminal and send it to a Laserwriter to see what it looked like, for all I know.
